author: wjmelements
content: how would you verify logs without the bloom filter in the block header?

author: wjmelements
content: State proofs should be part of future decentralized RPC. I know Metamask wants the feature. It should be added as optional to the ethjsonrpc standard by the first deRPC protocol to support it, and then hopefully everyone will adopt the same pattern.

author: wjmelements
content: Yes, I envision the proofs returned within the jsonrpc `result` for most methods

author: wjmelements
content: It won't necessarily be implemented that way but it would be great for making verification the default in standard web3 libraries.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: the bloom filter already isn't a perfect verification, since it's possible that two similar logs overlap.  But if you have the receipts root and access to all the receipts you can reconstruct the receipts trie yourself and verify you get the same root.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: I have an example of doing that manually here: https://replit.com/@ryanleeschneider/TrieTest

author: ryanleeschneider
content: and WIP code for converting the JSONRPC receipts response back into it's RLP here: https://github.com/INFURA/go-ethlibs/pull/63
